exercises.name: Crunches
steps: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Place your hands lightly behind your head or crossed over your chest.
Engage your core by pulling your belly button toward your spine.
Lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor while exhaling.
Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your abs.
Slowly lower back down to the starting position while inhaling.
tips: Do not pull on your neck with your hands.
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor.
Perform reps in a slow and controlled manner.

exercises.name: Planks
steps: Start in a forearm plank position with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line.
Engage your core by pulling your belly button toward your spine.
Keep your hips level and avoid sagging or piking.
Hold the position for the desired time while breathing steadily.
tips: Keep your neck neutral, looking at the floor.
Avoid holding your breath during the exercise.
Start with shorter holds and gradually increase duration.

exercises.name: Russian Twists
steps: Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet lifted slightly off the ground.
Lean back slightly to engage your core, keeping your back straight.
Hold a weight or clasp your hands together.
Twist your torso to the right, then to the left, moving the weight or hands.
tips: Keep your movements controlled to avoid strain.
Engage your core, not your arms, to drive the twist.
Place feet on the ground for an easier variation.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
steps: Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders.
Engage your core and bring one knee toward your chest.
Quickly switch legs, bringing the other knee toward your chest.
Continue alternating legs at a steady pace.
tips: Keep your core tight to avoid bouncing.
Maintain a straight back and avoid lifting your hips too high.
Start with a slower pace to master form.

exercises.name: Push-ups
steps: Start in a high plank position with hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows.
Push back up to the starting position while keeping your core engaged.
tips: Keep elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body.
Avoid letting your hips sag or pike up.
Modify by dropping to your knees if needed.

exercises.name: Bicep Curls
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Keep your elbows close to your sides and palms facing up.
Curl the weights toward your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
Lower the weights back down with control.
tips: Avoid swinging your body to lift the weights.
Keep your elbows stationary throughout the movement.
Use a weight that allows full range of motion.

exercises.name: Tricep Dips
steps: Sit on a bench or chair with hands gripping the edge beside your hips.
Extend your legs and lift your hips off the bench.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until they form a 90-degree angle.
Push back up to the starting position using your triceps.
tips: Keep your shoulders away from your ears.
Avoid locking your elbows at the top.
Bend your knees for an easier variation.

exercises.name: Pull-ups
steps: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Engage your core and pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.
Lower yourself back down with control until arms are fully extended.
tips: Avoid swinging or using momentum to lift yourself.
Use a resistance band for assistance if needed.
Keep your shoulders away from your ears.

exercises.name: Rows
steps: Hold a barbell or dumbbells with an overhand grip, bending at the hips.
Keep your back straight and pull the weight toward your lower chest.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
Lower the weight back down with control.
tips: Maintain a neutral spine to avoid strain.
Use a weight that allows controlled movement.
Keep your elbows close to your body.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldowns
steps: Sit at a lat pulldown machine and grip the bar wider than shoulder-width.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest, squeezing your lats.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position with control.
tips: Avoid pulling the bar behind your neck.
Keep your chest up and shoulders back.
Use a weight that allows smooth motion.

exercises.name: Deadlifts
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over mid-foot.
Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar with a mixed or overhand grip.
Lift the bar by pushing through your heels, keeping it close to your body.
Stand tall, then lower the bar back down with control.
tips: Keep your back straight to avoid injury.
Engage your core throughout the lift.
Use a lighter weight to practice form.

exercises.name: Squats
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Engage your core and keep your chest upright.
Lower your hips back and down as if sitting into a chair.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
tips: Keep your knees in line with your toes.
Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
Go as deep as your mobility allows without rounding your back.

exercises.name: Hip Thrusts
steps: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, barbell across your hips.
Plant your feet flat, hip-width apart.
Drive through your heels to lift your hips until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
Lower your hips back down with control.
tips: Keep your chin tucked to maintain a neutral neck.
Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement.
Use padding on the bar for comfort.

exercises.name: Glute Bridges
steps: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, hip-width apart.
Engage your core and squeeze your glutes.
Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Lower your hips back down with control.
tips: Keep your feet close to your glutes for better activation.
Avoid overarching your lower back.
Add a weight across your hips for added resistance.

exercises.name: Lunges
steps: Stand with feet together, holding dumbbells or bodyweight.
Step forward with one leg, lowering your back knee toward the ground.
Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other leg.
tips: Keep your front knee over your ankle.
Maintain an upright torso throughout.
Step far enough to keep balance.

exercises.name: Bench Press
steps: Lie flat on a bench with feet planted on the floor.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar to your mid-chest while keeping elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Push the bar back up to the starting position.
tips: Keep your wrists straight and shoulders retracted.
Use a spotter for heavy weights.
Avoid bouncing the bar off your chest.

exercises.name: Chest Flyes
steps: Lie on a bench holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows and open your arms out to the sides.
Bring the weights back together over your chest, squeezing your pecs.
tips: Avoid locking your elbows or overstretching.
Use a weight that allows controlled motion.
Focus on the chest contraction at the top.

exercises.name: Dips
steps: Grip parallel bars and lift your body, keeping arms straight.
Lean slightly forward to target the chest.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until shoulders are below elbows.
Push back up to the starting position.
tips: Keep your shoulders away from your ears.
Avoid locking your elbows at the top.
Use assistance if needed for beginners.

exercises.name: Burpees
steps: Start in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart.
Squat down and place your hands on the floor.
Jump your feet back into a plank position.
Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back toward your hands.
Explosively jump up, reaching your arms overhead.
tips: Keep your core tight to protect your lower back.
Modify by stepping back instead of jumping if needed.
Maintain a steady pace to avoid fatigue.

exercises.name: Thrusters
steps: Hold a barbell or dumbbells at shoulder height, feet shoulder-width apart.
Squat down, keeping the weights stable.
Push through your heels to stand, pressing the weights overhead.
Lower the weights back to shoulder height.
tips: Keep your core engaged throughout.
Use a smooth, continuous motion.
Choose a weight that allows proper form.

exercises.name: Clean & Press
steps: Start with a barbell on the ground, feet hip-width apart.
Pull the bar to your hips, flipping your elbows under to catch it at shoulder height.
Press the bar overhead until arms are fully extended.
Lower the bar back to the ground with control.
tips: Use your legs to drive the initial pull.
Keep the bar close to your body.
Practice with a light weight to master technique.

exercises.name: Turkish Get-ups
steps: Lie on your back holding a kettlebell or dumbbell in one hand, arm extended.
Roll onto your side and sit up, keeping the weight overhead.
Push up to a kneeling position, then stand fully.
Reverse the steps to return to the starting position.
tips: Keep your eyes on the weight throughout.
Move slowly to maintain balance.
Practice without weight to learn the movement.

exercises.name: Calf Raises
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, optionally on an elevated surface.
Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels.
Pause at the top, squeezing your calves.
Lower your heels back down with control.
tips: Keep your movements slow and controlled.
Avoid bouncing at the bottom of the movement.
Add weight for increased difficulty.

exercises.name: Toe Raises
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, weight on your heels.
Lift your toes upward, engaging your shin muscles.
Hold briefly at the top, then lower your toes back down.
tips: Perform slowly to maximize shin activation.
Use a wall for balance if needed.
Avoid rocking your body during the movement.

exercises.name: Jump Rope
steps: Hold a jump rope with handles in each hand, rope behind you.
Swing the rope over your head and jump as it passes under your feet.
Land softly on the balls of your feet, keeping a steady rhythm.
tips: Keep your elbows close to your sides.
Use your wrists to swing the rope, not your arms.
Start with short sessions to build endurance.

exercises.name: Box Jumps
steps: Stand in front of a sturdy box, feet shoulder-width apart.
Squat slightly, then explosively jump onto the box.
Land softly with both feet, standing fully upright.
Step or jump back down and repeat.
tips: Choose a box height that challenges but allows safe landing.
Use your arms to help with momentum.
Ensure the box is stable and non-slip.

exercises.name: Neck Rolls
steps: Stand or sit with a straight spine and relaxed shoulders.
Slowly roll your head in a circular motion, clockwise then counterclockwise.
Move gently through a full range of motion.
tips: Avoid forcing your neck beyond comfortable range.
Keep movements slow to prevent dizziness.
Perform in both directions equally.

exercises.name: Neck Stretches
steps: Sit or stand with a straight spine.
Gently tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear toward your shoulder.
Hold for 15–30 seconds, then switch sides.
tips: Keep your shoulders relaxed and down.
Avoid pulling too hard on your head.
Breathe deeply during the stretch.

exercises.name: Resistance Band Pulls
steps: Secure a resistance band to a stable anchor at head height.
Hold the band with both hands and step back to create tension.
Pull the band toward your face, keeping your neck stable.
Return to the starting position with control.
tips: Use a light band to avoid strain.
Keep your neck in a neutral position.
Focus on controlled movement.

exercises.name: Shoulder Press
steps: Sit or stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at shoulder height.
Engage your core and press the weights overhead until arms are extended.
Lower the weights back to shoulder height with control.
tips: Avoid locking your elbows at the top.
Keep your core tight to avoid arching your back.
Use a weight that allows smooth motion.

exercises.name: Lateral Raises
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Raise your arms out to the sides until they're at shoulder height.
Lower the weights back down with control.
tips: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Avoid swinging the weights or shrugging your shoulders.
Use light weights to maintain form.

exercises.name: Front Raises
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Raise one or both arms forward to shoulder height, palms down.
Lower the weights back down with control.
tips: Keep your core engaged to avoid leaning back.
Use a controlled motion to prevent swinging.
Alternate arms for unilateral variation.

exercises.name: Shrugs
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Shrug your shoulders upward toward your ears.
Hold briefly, then lower your shoulders back down.
tips: Avoid rolling your shoulders; lift straight up.
Keep your arms relaxed and straight.
Use a weight that allows controlled movement.

exercises.name: Leg Press
steps: Sit in a leg press machine with feet hip-width apart on the platform.
Push the platform away by extending your legs, keeping knees slightly bent.
Lower the platform back down until knees are at a 90-degree angle.
tips: Keep your back flat against the seat.
Avoid locking your knees at the top.
Adjust foot placement for different muscle emphasis.

exercises.name: Wall Sits
steps: Stand with your back against a wall, feet about 2 feet away.
Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, knees at 90 degrees.
Hold the position, keeping your core engaged.
tips: Keep your back flat against the wall.
Place hands on hips or thighs, not pushing on knees.
Start with shorter holds and increase duration.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
steps: Lie on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
Press the weights up until your arms are fully extended.
Lower the weights back down to shoulder level with control.
tips: Keep your wrists straight and elbows slightly tucked.
Avoid bouncing the weights off your chest.
Use a spotter for heavier weights.

exercises.name: Barbell Rows
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip.
Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight and bar close to your shins.
Pull the bar to your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades.
Lower the bar back down with control.
tips: Maintain a neutral spine to avoid strain.
Keep the bar close to your body throughout.
Use a weight that allows proper form.

exercises.name: Arnold Press
steps: Sit or stand, holding dumbbells in front of your shoulders, palms facing you.
Press the weights up while rotating your palms to face forward.
Lower the weights back down, rotating palms back toward you.
tips: Keep your core engaged to avoid arching your back.
Use a smooth, controlled rotation.
Choose a weight that allows full range of motion.

exercises.name: Hammer Curls
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing in.
Curl the weights toward your shoulders, keeping palms facing in.
Lower the weights back down with control.
tips: Avoid swinging your body to lift the weights.
Keep your elbows close to your sides.
Use a weight that allows controlled movement.

exercises.name: Skull Crushers
steps: Lie on a bench holding a barbell or dumbbells above your chest, arms extended.
Bend your elbows to lower the weight toward your forehead.
Extend your arms back to the starting position.
tips: Keep your elbows stationary and pointing upward.
Use a spotter for heavier weights.
Lower the weight slowly to avoid injury.

exercises.name: Overhead Press
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height.
Engage your core and press the bar overhead until arms are fully extended.
Lower the bar back to shoulder height with control.
tips: Avoid leaning back excessively during the lift.
Keep the bar path straight and close to your face.
Use a weight that allows smooth, controlled movement.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip.
Keep your knees slightly bent and hinge at the hips to lower the bar.
Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping the bar close to your legs.
Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
tips: Maintain a neutral spine to avoid rounding your back.
Keep the bar close to your legs throughout.
Use a weight that allows proper form.

exercises.name: Face Pulls
steps: Attach a rope to a cable machine at face height.
Grip the rope with both hands and step back to create tension.
Pull the rope toward your face, aiming for your ears, squeezing your rear delts.
Return to the starting position with control.
tips: Keep your elbows high and shoulders back.
Use a light weight to focus on form.
Avoid jerking the weight toward you.
